Reviews.Title: “I don’t normally complain, but… billing beware.”
Reviews.Author: Sparky_buckwheat
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was average and to be expected for a basic hotel chain. Of special note, the shuttle drivers were friendly and helpful, the receptionists on check in and check out were friendly, and the restaurant staff was efficient and accommodating. On the room side, the bathroom setup was awkward (I could see a bigger person having difficulty), and the bed was incredibly soft (my wife and I are 130 and 140 lbs). With that being said, I am saddened to see that I am not the first person to have a voucher issue at this hotel, however this time they didn’t lose ours. They must have learned since then that it is more cost effective to bill you and use the voucher. When our flight was delayed, we were given a voucher for the hotel. We had a reservation previously, and mentioned this on check in when we handed the voucher in. We were assured the voucher would be used to pay for the room, as we were under the impression that the airline was paying for our room due to the severe delay that occurred. We had no issues when we checked out in person. When we arrived home, the hotel had charged us for the room. We spoke with the billing clerk and the hotel service manager, and unfortunately we were able to see how this hotel is interested in the bottom line, not the client. We were told that we were paying for our room and the voucher had been used for the room booked by the airline (which seems to me like they wanted to charge for two rooms, even though we only stayed in one). After much discussion and difficulty, we settled with a $25 service charge rather than the full room charge. So, even when they assure you there will be no problem, be sure to check everything and expect a "by the book" response if there is a billing issue. Both my wife and I work in customer service jobs and we go out of our way to ensure that the customer is satisfied and will return. The way the hotel handled this billing issue was not the way either of us would have dealt with it. Unfortunately, because of this response, we will not be returning to this hotel as there are many other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: coloradowoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on business, first of all thank goodness I did not have a rental car they charge guests 14.00 per night for self-paking and by the way they have airport parking as well so you may have to park some distance. (Really, charge your guests the same rate as somebody going to the airport....) The staff are extremely friendly, a big plus. The workout room is very nice (good equipment) Restaurant is expensive but good. Breakfast was very expensive. Room was ok nothing spectacular. My bathroom was pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Centre, Close to Toronto Int'l Airport”
Reviews.Author: freezing1
Reviews.Content: Just a 5 minute ride from the airport via free shuttle. Proximity to the airport is important when your stay is less than 24 hours. I stayed here February 8th to attend a conference being held at this hotel. I flew in to Toronto via WestJet, waited 5 minutes to take the free airport shuttle to the hotel. Check in was quick and the front desk staff were pleasant. The lobby area is quite beautiful. The room was spacious and had what I needed - full bathroom, king sized bed, nice bedding, pillow selection, coffee maker, alarm clock. No fridge. The hotel had free WiFi, which I appreciate. In what seems to be a trend for me lately, my room was right beside one of the many elevators, so I had the displeasure of hearing the elevator whirl all night. Other than that, the bed was comfortable and I was unable to hear other guests in the hallway or in their rooms. The conference facilities are good, the lunch served was also good for a buffet-style meal for 150 people. There were hotel staff constantly cleaning up dishes, glasses, etc., and doing a good job of keeping conference attendees happy. I would stay here again, but ask for a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Business or Near YYZ”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok and serves the purpose well. The staff are ok. The place is clean and the rooms have all been just redone. But something is missing with this place that I cannot put my finger on. I came for a weekend while my wife was here for a weeks conference and came the last weekend of her visit to pick up our kitten at the airport. The place is clean but the bath is really small; there is a second sink and vanity outside of the bathroom; but the first room they gave us was not fully done up like someone was in it after it was cleaned - they moved us right away. There are lots of restaurants nearby too. The restaurant is ok too but busy with such a large hotel. Try to get a room on the east face away from the airport and freeway side - a little quieter, but the west side is fine also - it will not keep you up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonbarteaux
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn must send thier staff to stellar service school. because it is. Great attitude and really care about your stay and want you to come back. I continue to visit and stay at Holiday Inns in Canada and always have a great staff experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for stopover at airport!”
Reviews.Author: Mymillymolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it had the lowest prices for park and fly (included, 8 days). Usually we stay at the Radisson (all suites) down the road, so I can offer a comparison here. The hotel is very close to the airport and the shuttle did not stop along the way, it is approx 5 - 7 minutes drive. It was late picking us up by 10 mins, no big deal. We waited over 30 mins when we landed for a return shuttle but that may have been because some folks got on the wrong bus - when it arrived the driver was unceremoniously throwing them (a family with a young child) back off the bus! Not a great impression. Given the # of HI in the area, I'm not sure it was entirely their fault (buses show up randomly and you always need to check yourself if they're going where you want). It is a typical HI - nice lobby, the staff EXTREMELY friendly and professional. The rooms were small compared to the Radisson which has a sitting area and sleeping area. But the heated bathroom floor is a nice touch. Shower was great. Amenities - shampoo, lotion, shower cap. Beds were comfortable but I found the pillows really "stuffed' (just a personal thing, I don't like my head at a 45 degree angle to sleep). We did not use the restaurant. The TV channels were great, everything you'd probably need. No fridge in room but a/c worked great. In short, good location for airport, excellent staff, comfortable rooms - I would stay here again if they offered the best rate, otherwise probably return to Radisson. Both offer park & fly rates with above-ground parking, both close to airport, both have restaurants on-site, Radisson has a separate sitting area and pull-out couch good for families.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at the airport”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanCanadaQueen
Reviews.Content: stayed at the toronto international airport holiday inn...great stay. we had a very nice comfy room, beds are great. good parking and shuttle picks you up and brings you to and from the airport. we always stay at the double tree hotel there...but in my opinion this place is no different. would stay here again in a minute....

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms - Bad Restaurant Service”
Reviews.Author: bogygirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times over the years. The rooms have always been clean and decent. The heated bathroom floors are so nice. The restaurant and lounge though are something else though. Service is extremely slow and the staff just doesn't seem to really care. The prices are also quite high. We usually either walk to Timmy's just down the street or order delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good rates. Close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: sanman249
Reviews.Content: A very nice Holiday Inn close to the Toronto Intl Airport. Shuttles to the airport depart every 20-30 mins. The rooms are good and quite modern. There is free wifi in the rooms. No complaints here! Just that they charge $14 for parking in an area where parking is freely available.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service with Attitude”
Reviews.Author: PATIOLATERN
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel because Hotel Indigo did not have the 24 hr shuttle and Indigo sent us to the wrong Holiday inn. Never in my life have we been so rudly treated by a front desk person. Ada was her name and yes we were at her hotel by mistake but if that is the way she treats customers then Holiday inn is in trouble. Wow what a pc of work. I did file a complaint with Holiday Inn too

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: packingandunpacking
Reviews.Content: I often stay at this hotel either at the beginning or end of a trip out of Toronto Pearson. In the spacious, comfortable lobby, there is morning coffee and free computers/internet to use. Wifi is also free! The 24 hour shuttle service is efficient, running every 20 minutes and it's about 5 minutes, door to door, from hotel to airport terminal. While staying here last week, I had dinner at the on-site the restaurant. I appreciated the way I was treated, as a single traveller, and had a good meal, then settled in for a brief sleep before an early morning flight. Even though the hotel is very close to the airport, I didn't hear a single plane flying over.

Reviews.Title: “Nice executive suites, closest hotel to the airport”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Nice executive suites, closest hotel to the airport, helpful staff, great long-term parking rates for PC members ($10/day, 1 day complimentary). 8/10

Reviews.Title: “Well, at least it's close to the airport...”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on Priceline (bid 3-stars in GTA) and decided to try it out since we usually stay in Markham when visiting Toronto. Itâ€™s a large hotel with all the amenities needed, including free wireless internet (must call front desk for passcode); but you do have to pay $14/day for parking. There is a free shuttle to the airport which is useful if needed. Overall hotel is clean and in good shape. The lobby, swimming pool, workout gym, elevator, and restaurants are well kept. Rooms are a bit outdated but serves its purpose just fine for a 3-star hotel. The hotel is decent compared to other similar hotels, but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it for a relaxing weekend because of the excessive airplane noise. Location to the airport and downtown Toronto is good, but there is nothing within walking distance. There is a 24hr Subway and shawarma restaurant next door for a quick bite, but prices are higher than usual. Tuckers Marketplace (buffet) up the street at 15 Carlson Court (corner of Dixon) is a good restaurant choice that wonâ€™t break the bank like The Keg across the street. Overall, the staff and hotel property is good. The location isnâ€™t that bad. But the loud noise of planes taking off and landing made it impossible to get a good night sleep... For that reason alone, I cannot recommend this hotel. Stay here only if you need to use the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Speed Limited Internet”
Reviews.Author: Jared H
Reviews.Content: "High Speed" is a relative term. Be warned: Holiday Inn has low standards when it comes to the internet they offer. My experience: Stayed for business last week. Needed access to my company's server over a VPN connection. Found the internet to be VERY slow. Turns out they cap everybody to a maximum download speed of 0.5Mbps at this hotel. This is technically "High Speed Internet".... NOT "Broadband" which I think is what most people expect when they visit a business friendly hotel. Also found out that 0.5Mbps (64kBps) meets or exceeds Holiday Inn's corporate standards... HA! What kind of standard is that? Everyone in Canada that has High Speed Internet is accustomed to 10 times that. I wonder where else they're cutting corners and we don't know about it. Anyway, I'm back at a Hilton this week and I'm downloading at over 30Mbps! And yes, it's free here too. If you're not going to be using internet, this hotel is okay. Overall it's a nice place, price is reasonable, a little noisy due to the proximity to the airport but you'd be crazy not to expect that. One more thing. The General Manager listened to my issue with the internet not being "high speed" and essentially came back with a reply that their internet is essentially for checking email and browsing the internet. Forget VPN, email ATTACHMENTS, VIDEO streaming, etc. Ended up wasting a lot of time trying to get my job done here. The final word on my poor experience was "sorry you had issues..." , referenced internet terms agreement, "we're not going to compensate you in any way for the misunderstanding". The cost of two nights at their hotel is apparently worth more to them than keeping a customer happy and coming back. I travel for business often... I won't be staying here, at least until they change their standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRobDT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a night before an early flight out of Pearson due to its very close proximity to the airport. The shuttle fetched me from the terminal and the front desk clerk told me that the shuttle actually runs 24 hours which is quite convenient. The check-in was very fast and the front desk person ever so friendly--a large smile and such a warm personality. The room-- standard hotel size with a king size bed and bathroom. The room was spotless and a nice little surprise was the heated bathroom floor. Unfortunately I could not raise the temperature higher for the floor but it was still a nice touch when getting out of the shower. Towels, sheets and furniture were in excellent condition and the wireless worked great as well. Though I could hear the planes in the distance landing (it is practically next door to the airport) the noise was minimal and not at all intrusive. Sleeping was no issue at all. Would I stay again--- absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to host a business meeting not the best place if your looking to see the sights of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastrocs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for business on a couple of occasions over the last couple of years. The hotel was your average hotel, nothing unexpected from any other hoilday inn. Great proximity to the airport with free shuttle service. The service at this property was great, they looked after our every need. A great place if your looking to host a business meeting not the best place if your looking to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the group”
Reviews.Author: canehdiangrl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on two occasions - the first time was a few years ago, and most recently, for 2 nights in November. In between, I've stayed at some of the other hotels in the area, and I feel confident telling you that this hotel ranks #1 in terms of value, service, location, and amenities compared with other area hotels. The online price for the basic room was $160 - I would never pay full price when good ol' Hotwire sells it for so much less, but for the discount I got, I thought it was good value. Service - check in was fast. They offered free coffee in the morning and a free newspaper. There is a computer room to check your email/internet. I'm not sure about WiFi. For a single woman travelling alone, the hotel and area felt safe. Room - basic, with comfy beds, Bath&Body Works amenities, and your choice of "soft" or "hard" pillows. I did not hear jet noise like I did when I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Airport. Fitness - They have a very nice gym here. Several ellipticals, treadmills. I didn't use the pool, but it was practically empty and it looked nice. Restaurant - I ate dinner in the main restaurant and I enjoyed it - it was better than I thought it would be for hotel food, even though the cappucino machine was broken. I also found it reasonably priced (for the area). Location - Close to the airport, across the street from The Keg, and within walking distance to Subway, Caseys, a Shwarma place, and a few others. There is a Boston Pizza/Canyon Creek and a few others about a 10 minute walk away if you are ambitious. This hotel is what it is, a "stay and fly" hotel, but in this category, it's the best of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “front desk service super”
Reviews.Author: danewf
Reviews.Content: we arrived here on friday nov25,amber was on front desk,was wonderful to us.Suggest changing our current reservation to better rate that included breakfast and parking.She was so nice and friendly with us,welcomed us to toronto.Thank you Amber Just one thing that could good with major improvement,folks that serve the bar could only smile and be friendly would make this very nice pub to have a night cap in.same goes for the restaurant they were not at all friendly when we ate there on saturday morning.Because of this next time I would not use this place to eat or have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Fly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freerain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Leave you car and fly! Just wish they made some cosmetic renovations. The rooms on the exectuvive level are a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to basic Holiday Inn expectations”
Reviews.Author: SaskatoonResident
Reviews.Content: The airport shuttle is very undersized for a moderate sized hotel. A large group arrived at the same time, and the Hotel refused to use its second shuttle. The less busy Hilton, Marriot's etc. all had larger shuttles. On arrival, check in was slow. They mixed rooms up. The shower head was plastic, and provided inadequate pressure to keep me warm. Despite a recent "sign" upgrade, and change to Holiday Inn, this hotel has no attempts at room upgrades. A solid step down from a recent Day Inn and Super 8 I had stayed at. The Worst Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at. I would recommend any other area hotels, there are lots, for adequate water pressure, adequate shuttle size, and maybe, just maybe, a little conditioner, or at least shampoo-conditioner in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to Toronto Intl Airport, and offers 1-or-2 week parking with a special room rate”
Reviews.Author: fred_cameron
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn has friendly staff, free wifi, a nice pool, and a great breakfast buffet. Rooms are large and comfortable. They have "park, stay, and go rates" for a room plus long-term parking -- attractive if you need a place to stay before an early flight. Or vice versa, park, travel for a week, spend a night, and drive off the next day. If you need to spend a night at the airport anyway, check their rates against the other long-term parking options. Check with hotel in advance to make arrangements for this option. All and all, this hotel is competitive with the other chains in their class. Offers convenient location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent to Airport”
Reviews.Author: ambrai5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after a long flight from Europe. This hotel is right off the airport, is very clean and fairly modernized. The main compliant I have with this hotel is that they charge for every little thing. Breakfast was a whopping 22 CAD per person for what most hotels give for free. Restaurant service was appallingly slow and inefficient. Parking was another whopping 15 CAD per day which is almost what you'd pay at the actual airport. The beds were clean and nice with lots of pillows (yeah). Bathrooms were tiny which seems to be a running trend in newer hotels, I hate to complain but I should be able to sit on the toilet and close the door. Pros: Close to airport Free shuttle to airport Clean and Modern Cons: Overpriced "amenities" Bad restaurant service

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Content: There are many airport hotels that people use for business. The internet was down. For the whole hotel. Need I say any more? This is a tired beaten property that needs a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean quiet and Friendly staff. Great beds!!!!”
Reviews.Author: atrd86
Reviews.Content: I had a cancelled flight and grabbed a room here for the night. I was very hungry, tired and irritable. When I got there everything was very clean and the staff got me in at a good rate right away. The room I had was very nice and had a very comfortable king bed. I had a very good burger and a beer in the lounge. I was helped out right away and the bartender squeaked my order in right in time where he could have just as easily not accepted it as I was right at or a few min. over the cut-off for the kitchen. I had a very comfortable sleep and was up early and grabbed the complimentary shuttle back to the airport in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stop-over!”
Reviews.Author: takeoutthetrash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to flying out on an early morning flight, and was pleased with mostly everything. The price was right at $87/night, and we enjoyed the outdoor pool as it was a warm day. The hotel also offered an indoor pool as well as an exercise room. The check-in was flawless, the King room was on the Executive floor, but I didn't really grasp what was so different from the regular rooms?!? I have stayed here before, and other than a bottle of water given to you, the decor of the room was pretty much the same. It did seem that the room was a little tired, and probably needing a refurbish in the near future. Other than that, it was clean, comfortable and dead quite, even though the hotel was busy. The restaurant was also very good and offered a wide selection. I will stay here again, the staff were very good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: SierraF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit dated and could use some repair and updating. Additionally, there is a cheap hotel scent in the hallways (cheap deodorizer and old carpets). For context, we stayed on the priority club/executive floor (10th) and visited the 11th floor as well. On the up side, the staff was pleasant, our room was clean, and the restaurant was adequate, if overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want it, did not book it, but... what a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kickdiver
Reviews.Content: We usually try to avoid Holiday Inn chain, but we were with the International Airshow, and that is where they accommodated us. We tried to book into another hotel first, but were not able to do so, due to mandatory morning briefings and the requirement to stay with the team in the same property. The beds were extremely comfortable. The service was impeccable. The breakfast was surprisingly delightful. No complaints there. As a matter of fact, it was delicious, again, their service: outstanding. All in all. This hotel exceeded my expectations in term of customer service. Bad thing: we were moved from one room next to the elevator to another in immediate elevator vicinity. But..we got used to it to the sounds of the never resting elevator, lol. I guess. Oh , and I could have done without the chain-smoking valet guy, who gave me a rather unwelcoming introduction to the property by yelling:'close your car door', lol, but ..hey , that 's minor stuff, it all got better from there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Holiday Inn - would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: monketteDouglasIOM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did an overnight stop from London to Toronto to break our trip to Nassau in the Bahamas.The staff were very welcoming and the room very nice and clean.It has a super pool which you can see on your arrival in the reception.It also has a nice bar in which we met some friendly locals.As we were tired we ordered room service.My Husbands meal was good but mine was not really very nice - maybe I ordered the wrong dish.There is a convenient shuttle bus to the airport which is free and quick to the airport.Certainly would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “no A/C room”
Reviews.Author: RikHD
Reviews.Content: hi, got there at midnight, there were no a/c in the room, it was 40 degrees, and they give me an handicapped room with no a/c also, I didn't sleep, and I will never go back there, very very bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Advanced, non-refundable rates were good”
Reviews.Author: danno c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights while attending our sons basketball tournament at Humber College. We opted for the non-refundable advance booking to save big on an executive king room. The rate included parking, breakfast and local calls. The buffet breakfast was great, restaurant staff a real pleasure. Before we rented a car the helpful front desk staff radioed a taxi who was waiting right outside. We paid $22 for our trip to Humber campus and $16 for the return trip.... hhmmm. So we rented a car and learned the taxi took an unnecessarily long route to Humber. Not a lot of $ to be sure but I hate being ripped off!! The cab driver gave us his card so we could pay his inflated rate every day, there and back, for a week... if I hadn't tossed that card I would name him and the cab company here. We found the room small for a 'Executive King' room. I would not have been happy if we had paid full price. With the car rental we saved $15 a day on parking and we saved $40 a day on breakfast, (it was a really good breakfast). All the staff we very very nice. Airport shuttle and lots of near by car rentals to choose from. The friendly and professional staff make a huge difference to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel facilities, very close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: JetSetBlu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near the airport and as such lacks easy access to downtown. However, there are still lots of restaurants within a 5 minute walk. The hotel restaurant was very good too and had a good atmosphere in the evening to get a drink after work. No real shopping/entertainment closeby but that's probably not why you would stay here. The hotel also has 2 pools, a good exercise room and a convenience store right in the building that even carries some healthy snacks. Beds were very nice and a good selection of pillows. A big plus was that I hardly heard any noise from the halls. I really liked the business centre - I never had to wait for a computer and the internet was fast. It's a bit expensive but the hotel and rooms are kept up well - which for some reason I find to be an exception among airport hotels. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: krm500
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way to our vacation. Check-in was prompt and the staff were very helpful. When we told them we were using the Park n Fly, they beat the Park n Fly rate by 15%. The airport shuttle made it very convenient to catch our flight the next morning. Rooms were clean and spacious. Very little noise despite being so close to the airport. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel right by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a short 5 minute drive away from Toronto airport. They have a free shuttle bus that operates quite frequently. The rooms at the hotel were of good quality. The bathroom floors were nice and heated. They offered free wi-fi in the room. There was also a decent gym in the basement of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel in the evening as the airport shuttle was unloading. This meant there was a line to check in. I was given a room on the 6th floor and when I opened the door I was immediately greeted by the strong smell of urine. I went down to the front desk and was switched to another room. Overall, the customer service wasn't the best. The new room as OK. For the most part it was clean and spacious. I think they renovated the rooms in recent years. There were two beds, a computer desk and a small table with two chairs. The bathroom was very smell and it to had a smell of urine (however, it was quite clean). I am not sure where the urine smell is coming from, maybe the shower curtains? One thing I need to highlight is that I had two double beds. I was lying down in one of the beds and noticed that the sheets and pillows had a strong scent of mens cologne (definitely not my own). I then switched over to the other bed that did not have the smell. I pray that these sheets were cleaned. Overall the beds were quite comfortable. I noticed that they had an outdoor pool and possibly an indoor pool. Not too sure what other amenities are available as I was at this hotel briefly as a stop over before going home. Free wifi was a nice touch! Parking is a bit steep ($14/day). Location is really nice, close to Highway 401 and 427. It's also across from the airport with a regular shuttle coming to pick up guests. I did not use this service so I do not know the price or frequency.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the airport”
Reviews.Author: travelpair55
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times and it has yet to disappoint. Rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious and beds have a choice of soft or firm pillows. Should you chose not to eat in the Metropolitan Restaurant in the hotel, there is a good selection of restaurants within walking distance. Ideally located for those catching a flight. We've always found a good hotel rate for parknfly and the hotel has complimentary shuttles which run approx every 20 mins to and from the airport. Will continue to use this hotel when we need a place near YYZ.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bookflyer
Reviews.Content: This place is all about location. The proximity to the airport is perfect. If you make a right turn out of the lot there is a station to fill your rental car before returning it to the airport. The lounge could have been configured a little better to accommodate the guests. Instead of wingback chairs with low tables, I'd suggest hightops on the outer ring around the bar. The business center was useful and quick (and free). My checkin was quick and painless, and I had a room which had all I needed for a quick one night stay before my morning flight. The shower was average for a HI property. The fitness center was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...if you get it for a good price”
Reviews.Author: JamaicanDaisy
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Holiday Inn Internation before a flight to Jamaica in the morning. The good - location, price (thank you Priceline - I would never pay the advertised rate for the hotel) The bad - Hotel looks a bit old. Lobby looks dated. Carpets in the hallways were dated. Room itself was OK but the bedding was very thin and cheap. People at reception were not the friendliest, seemed disinterested All in all an OK stay but definately look for a cheap price. Not worth the advertised rate in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, for an Airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: velezmedez
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the hotel the line was a bit long and when you get there from an 8-9hr drive could be a bit overwhelming. The pricing of the hotel for me was a bit overpriced for a one night stay at an airport hotel $180CAD, which didn't include the $14CAD for parking. We get right to our room and down to the restaurant which service was a bit disappointing. To be seated you have to wait a good 15 minutes until someone approaches you. Some people coming after us since their wait was longer than ours, decided to grab their own menus and seat themselves and still no one shows up for an apology. You order drinks, which takes another 10-15mins to be brought and make sure to rush your decision of what to eat before the waitress would bring drinks as you can wait for another 20mins before someone returns to take an order. Food presentation was ok for where youâ€™re staying, flavor somewhat good and when your bill comes, hold some attention to yourself as your eyes may open so wide and not realize, way OVERPRICED. We return to our room soon after dinner is over. I then pay attention to details of it, the room was extremely small, 2 double beds, comfortable, pillow choice was very limited, bathroom also extremely small for two people, imagine for three of us, for which I would suggest to book 2 connecting rooms where you may end up a bit comfortable. The surface of the hotel where clean and when you look beyond might end up a bit shock, the customer service was okay, except of two young ladies who were at reception in the morning, they were great. The rest of the staff would be an okay score. We wake up and pack to leave and head to the airport as one of the parties was travelling. When it comes to pick up by the FREE shuttle service the hotel offers, after waiting a WHOLE hour for a service which is suppose to drive around â€œevery 20mins, after the hourâ€� after a few phone calls to the hotel to ask whatâ€™s happened to the shuttle and extremely exhausted, I decide to grab a taxi and go back to check out the hotel and leave, which at that time we were already desperate to leave. Would I return to this property....I'm not sure! Would I recommend.....like above, not sure!!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: hicynthia13
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Toronto Airport â€“ A pleasant surprise, I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Toronto Airport Hotel for one night to catch an early morning connection flight. I normally would not select a Holiday Inn Hotel as they are usually a bit run down. I was flying Business Class with Air Canada and they provided a comp night with the purchase of my ticket. The hotel has recently completed upgrades and renovations so the rooms are nicely decorated and they have nice new towels. The lobby was bright and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The onsite restaurant was OK â€¦.what you would expect for an airport hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing a hotel close to the airport as it is newly renovated and therefore a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Normal Holiday Inn hotel but nothing special either. Good for one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: wickerman767
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there just for one night on my way from Chicago to Montreal. We've arrived around 4-5am and were the last to check-in. Didn't really have time or strength to enjoy anything the hotel has to offer but it was quite OK for Holiday Inn standards. It was the best deal for good hotel in Toronto area so I'd definitely recommend it for good price! It's located literally next door to the airport but I didn't find it distracting, maybe 'cause I'm aviation enthusiast or I was tired as hell!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever happened to the customer is always right?”
Reviews.Author: fotogenicsmile
Reviews.Content: Air Canda wasn't able to accomodate me and two friends even though we had guaranteed seating. So, my two friends had seats but that left me to stay in Canada yet another da(the night before was another issue). One friend went on the flight while the other friend stood behind me to stay with me in a foreign country. So they sent me to Toronto Holiday Inn International Hotel. My friend and I had dinner at their restuaruant on the 1st floor. The meal was pleasant and so was the service. We were able to hand in our vouchers from Air Canada and American Airlines (AA also screwed us over but that is another story). So the next morning, we are trying to catch the shuttle bus to back it to the airport by 6am and the people at the front desk stated that I owed $25 from dinner. Now, this didn't make sense being that all of the vouchers were accepted. After disputing with the people at the front desk about the vouchers they told me that they will handle everything. Now I see a charge on my bank statement of the same $25. I called and spoke to the acountant, Mr. Tim Austin and he told me he doesn't see the vouchers from AA and I need to pay the $25. So, it appears as if they misplaced some of the vouchers and then charged me for it. I WILL NEVER GO BACK AND I WILL TELL FAMILY & FRIENDS NOT TO GO.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: Victag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before a flight the next morning. While the hotel and our room was clean, I expected more for the price we paid. This is partly because when I called the 1-800 # to book the room, they booked me for the wrong dates. After calls to correct this, the price started to go up since less rooms were available. While this makes sense normally, it seemed unfair that my wallet should suffer due to a mistake made by the reservation operator. Our kids quite enjoyed the stay and were given some goodie bags on arrival. They also enjoyed the 2 large pools which were clean and perfect temperature. We decided not to eat in the hotel since the menu did not appeal to us and also seemed expensive compared to the many alternatives nearby. Staff were friendly and couteous but did not go out of their way to help unpack luggage from our vehicle (which we did experience at hotels on previous nights). Our beds were comfortable and room was quiet considering how close to airport we were. If I didn't need to be close to airport, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with Holiday Inn standards, good sleeps had here..”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a consistently good place to stay in the Toronto airport area, this is a good hotel to choose. Formerly the Holiday Inn Select, they've now removed the 'Select' and simply branded this hotel a Holiday Inn. I don't really have anything negative to say about this hotel. The closest thing I can come up with is that it is average - but that should be your expectation with a Holiday Inn. The brand is not normally known for luxury. Therefore, it remains in line with many other HI's out there and, if anything, it's a touch nicer. The lobby area is comfortable and somewhat open. There is a seating area that you can make use of when waiting for the airport shuttle to come (which, by the way, runs every 20 minutes). Attached to the lobby are the restaurant and lounge, both which I have eaten in. I prefer the lounge for its simpler menu (try to Cookstown Greens with steak on top) and more relaxed atmosphere. I find the prices to be very reasonable, especially considering you are eating in a hotel. Rooms themselves have been touched up recently, and are very comfortable. There is a variety of pillows on the bed, and a nice semi-soft mattress. I find I have really great sleeps here. Other typical room furniture includes a desk and small seating area with a a table. In fact, I'd even say the rooms are nominally larger than normal. Bathrooms are regular sized and contain the new Bath & Body Works products, though the absence of conditioner is disappointing. A small vanity area separates the bathroom from the room as well, in case you need an extra table shelf. Leisure wise - internet is free by wireless in the room, and the signal is usually dependable. There is also an indoor pool (a touch on the warm side) and, I believe, in the summer there is also an outdoor pool. The gym in the basement is small but practical, containing a few cardio machines and an additional fitness area. The airport is located close to the hotel, and the shuttle runs frequently. This hotel is not located close to downtown, but the city can be reached by the GO Bus (the stop is close by) or public transit. Overall, a consistent and reliable hotel to sleep at. If you need to stay overnight in Toronto, this is a good place to do it. Fair prices for things like internet and food make it that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at the airport”
Reviews.Author: germaniris
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel very close to airport. Lobby nice as expected, carpets in hallways worn and lowered my expectations for the room. But I was pleasently surprise with nice and clean room, apparently recently rennovated. Overall pleasant stay. (No opinion on restaurant, did not try neither dinner nor breakfast.) OK value for money. Neighbourhood not very attractive. Would recommend location only if business requires fast access to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Mid Range Hotel - Impressed Enough to Recommend”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: Booked this on Priceline with air package, got a great rate, less than $75 USD per night. Exterior looks dated but interior was nice. Rooms were pleasant, bathrooms clean, service good. Free wi-fi. The pool was superb - one of the best hotels pools I've seen in awhile. Location is ok - is next to airport - only 15 minute drive to downtown, not a big deal unless you hit traffic. Holiday Inn Select is a solid 4 star hotel and if you can book it at a 2 or even 3 star rate, it's a good deal. Paying for parking $15 CAD per day was only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Airport area”
Reviews.Author: Ricovaloin
Reviews.Content: When I come to Toronto, I stay normally in this hotel due to the fact that my company has some interesting discounts here. The normal fare is a little bit on the high side, but this is common for hotels in this area. The rooms have been redecorated about two or three years ago. The decor of the rooms today look good and fresh. My room during this stay was clean. The bed was very confortable, except that the pillows were a little bit on the hard side. One drawback of this hotel is that the bathroom is very small. Last night, as I was working on my desk, I got the visit of some pigeons that had adopted my window as a refuge. They were quite noisy at times, but I was able to scare them away. They did not come back during the night to disturb me. Since this hotel is a high rise, located very close to the airport, I wouldn't say it is the quietest place to stay. The service at the front desk and restaurant was functional. The restaurant is not the greatest value for the price. I would recommend trying some of the restaurants close by to travellers looking for someting to satisfy their appetites.

Reviews.Title: “I Got What I Paid For.”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a whim through Hotwire.com for 40 dollars USD. My friends were coming in from Victoria, BC at 6:52am on a Sunday morning. To avoid me having to get up at 4:30am (I live 2 hours west of Toronto) to be at the Airport in time to pick them up I booked a hotel from the Saturday (the day before) to the Monday at a hotel with an Airport Shuttle. After booking through Hotwire.com the hotel was reveiled to be Holiday Inn Select. I had called a few times in the week prior to their visit to make sure that my friends had their names on the reservation (which required me calling holiday inn, then hotwire, and then hotwire called holiday inn to add their names). Then I called so that they knew no one would be checking in until Sunday morning (I booked saturday night because I wanted there to be a room ready that morning. Some hotels don't have check-in's earlier than noon, so I wanted to be on the safe side). I had also phoned to receive information on the shuttle. It was essential I had it clear for my friends. Sunday morning comes and I get a call around 7am from one of my friends saying that the shuttle hadn't shown up and they were told they needed to call the shuttle. Apparently there are two Holiday Inn's, one being west and the other east. She asked 'Which one are we?' I didn't know because I was never told. I scrambled to call the hotel thinking this would be a simple question for them to answer. I found out that the reservation line goes to somewhere in South Carolina. So not only did the girl I was speaking with have no idea what I was talking about, the computers were down and I had to wait to find out whether my friends should pick east or west. I was irritated beyond belief already, then my friend told me when she called the hotel they said they didn't have any of our three names on the reservation. I called the hotel and they said because I had booked for the Saturday, we have to call in and say the reservation date, not just our names. No one explained that to me when I phoned a week prior to tell the hotel NO ONE WAS CHECKING IN SATURDAY. By the time my friends were checked in it was already 8:20am. I was extremely upset that they had to deal with that so early in the morning and right after a long flight. As soon as the hotel staff realized I had booked with hotwire, they began to use it as a cop out. Saying 'when you book with a third party website, situations like this can arise.' I told them 'I don't appreciate you using Hotwire as an excuse for everything I've had to deal with this morning.' The hotel kept insisting I call Hotwire Customer Service, and when I did the girl was very understanding and told me 'This is an operational issue, Hotwire does NOT operate the hotel.' When I finally got to the hotel they had told me they upgraded my friends a better room. I walked in to see one giant king bed. The reservation said 4 people would be staying at the hotel. We had to have them switch us to another room. It was seriously issue after issue. Even when I spoke with the managment I was not truly satisfied. The most they did for me was validate my parking. By the end of my trip I found out my situation had become the story of the hotel, staffpeople knew who I was and were acting rudely towards me even though it was the hotel in the wrong, not me. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but........”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Before our arrival, I asked for details of the advertised shuttle bus from the airport. A prompt e-mail arrived stating that the bus ran every 15 minutes from shuttle bus stop C22 at Terminal 3. We waited there 45 minutes and no bus came. It then cost $17 in a taxi for a 1 mile journey. Reception apologised but with no adequate explanation (in our view the driver had not bothered to go to Terminal 3) and offered to send drinks to our room. None arrived--we rang down--drinks would arrive at 5pm because "no-one was on" till then. Wine finally arrived but it was undrinkable. The planned reception on Tuesdays for Priority Club members, though the letter we were given at check-in advertised it, was cancelled with no explanation. This was an inauspicious start after a flight from the UK As Platinum members we were upgraded to the Executive floor with a good-sized, if rather dark, well-equipped room. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was excellent, both at breakfast and at dinner. The journey into town without a car, involves taking the hotel shuttle to the airport and then bus 192 to Kipling subway station and then the subway into town. It takes about an hour all told but is feasible and cheap if you have plenty of time to spare. A taxi will cost you $50 one way. Overall, this is a good place to stay as a tourist if you want to save money on city centre hotels; you don't mind airport scenery; and are prepared to learn the logistics of getting to downtown by public transport which, though efficient and cheap, has a hassle factor. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunlover57
Reviews.Content: close to the sirport,comfortable rms however one BIG disadvantage, their was no room service after 11pm at night. We arrived at hotel at midnight after a long flight,tired and hungry..but like I say we ere informed that rm service had stopped at 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “3rd visit and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Stormlost
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel from April 20 through April 23. This was my husband's second stay at this hotel and my third. I have to say this time it disappointed us big time. The hotel only had us in their system for one night's stay, in spite of our reservation confirmation for 4 nights. The room was small, adequate for sleeping but made for cramped quarters for two of us. The air conditioner was not so noisy that you couldn't sleep at night which was a good thing. The bed was okay. Not the most comfortable, nor the most uncomfortable we've ever slept in. The pillows were a different story. Small and uncomfortable for the most part. The bathroom was closet sized. You had to move into the narrow space between the toilet & sink in order to close the door. The polyester shower curtains which are fully machine-washable were edged in black mold. The cramped space made it impossible to share the bathroom (we were on our honeymoon). Bathroom amenities were basic - shower cap, shampoo, conditioner, soap & body lotion. We chose this hotel for its proximity to Pearson Airport and highway 427. As it is an airport hotel, there really isn't much of a view, which is to be expected. Service was hit or miss in the lounge, depending on which staff member was working. The one who left us to find our own menus and left us waiting so long for service that my husband went hunting a drink for us both did not earn a tip from us. She was abrupt, lacked attention to detail regarding our orders, never smiled nor made us feel welcome in the least. Cobwebs dangled from part of the ceiling in the lounge. The other service personnel were good - one fellow in the restaurant recognized us at breakfast our first morning back at the hotel and made us feel very welcome. The bell service was also very good - both gentlemen were friendly, helpful and polite. The maid on our floor was from Jamaica. Very pleasant and friendly - we liked her a lot. The food was okay for the most part although we found it a bit expensive. There are several good restaurants to choose from just a short distance from the hotel and we took advantage of a few of them. The jacuzzi was taped off and definitely not functioning when we checked out the pool area. My husband inspected the sauna and found it less than clean so we decided to avoid the sauna & pool. This was a huge disappointment as we were looking forward to a soak in a jacuzzi, a good sweat in the sauna and a leisurely swim to relax us after our long flight. Although we saw other hotel staff - in the elevators, halls and lobby, not one smiled or said hello. Maybe it's a Toronto thing? I chose this hotel for it's proximity to the things we needed access to the most while staying in the GTA - the freeways and the airport. I also chose it based on a pleasant experience with the hotel in 2007, however for future trips we will be looking at another hotel in the same vicinity. We are not snobs, nor do we expect royal treatment, but for the most part this hotel let us down in areas that were important to us - mostly attention to detail related.

Reviews.Title: “Developing somewhat of a history with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Itsbeenawhile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in May of 08 due to a late flight from Cuba and a package that included a reasonable price and the ability to park our car in their lot for the week. The hotel was booked by our excellent travel agent. What we encountered at 2:00 am was nothing short of abuse...the parking deal no longer existed, an issue with the shuttle from the airport and an issue with our credit card. Yet, we rebooked the hotel again for on our return from the DR in January and the service this time was incredible and over-the-top. While describing our previous experience to the front-desk personnel they exchanged knowing glances at each other of who we had previously encountered. I am returning from business this Sunday and look forward to staying here again. I have rated this hotel based on that May/08 experience.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: CAnadaPhil
Reviews.Content: When our house was flooded, my family was booked into the Holiday Inn Select by our insurance agent. We were worried about being so near the airport with nothing for the kids to do, but we were wrong! My daughters were treated like princesses by the staff, they loved the indoor and the outdoor pool, and used the business centre to keep up with their emails. We lived at the hotel for 2 weeks before moving, and could not have been more impressed. There was no airport noise and the food was fantastic. Angela, one of the restaurant ladies, was so good with my kids and my wife, that we have often thought about going back for a meal just to say "hi". The maids were terrific too. Our room was always kept clean and tidy, and they often left extra chocolates on the girl's pillows. I have nothing but good things to say about the Holiday Inn and its wonderful staff, and would definitely reccommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 759 at the Holiday Inn Select Toronto Airport on October 29-30, 2008 for a business meeting. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and service at this hotel. When I arrived (early), my room wasn't ready and I wasn't able to check in. The bell man, however, was able to store my luggage at the front desk and I was able to check in after my first day of meetings ended. The service in the hotel restaurant was very good. The food was also more than acceptable. The hotel decor is modern and the facilities were in good condition. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. There is a small fitness room with 2 treadmills, 3 bicycles and an elliptical trainer as well as some free weights and a universal. Adequate but not expansive. The equipment was in good condition. One word of warning - one of my colleagues booked a "King Suite" because he needed to have a business meeting in his room one evening. However, when he got to his room, the "Suite" was really no larger than a regular room. This was quite disappointing and problematic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: buddyjessie
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, spotless property. Plenty of help for whatever your looking for. Right on busline, so getting around was a breeze. Airport shuttle ran frequently. Room was wonderful. Fitness center did the job. Business center had three internet ready computers. Didn't try dining options, but looked as nice as the rest of facility. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. It is right by the airport but you can't hear the planes. It has free shuttle that runs often and all the time (I took it on Monday morning at 5am). Price is nothing in comparison to what you get in return. The entire experience is superb: great lobby with awesome flowers, excellent efficient check in, brand new room and great restaurant with real food, not just some pub or diner food. If I lived nearby, I would actually come to this restaurant more often. I'm a vegetarian and they had good fish and sushi. Room was surprisingly big. Later I found out that they have just renovated hotel, so that explains why everything looked and smelled new. I liked the blue and brown colors, how clean room was and most of all - how practical it was. Imagine all the little details you miss while travelling - they had them! For example, they had well lit bathroom with great massaging shower head and enlarging mirror with light for shaving/make up. Or there was a hook to hang your purse on. Little things like this made a huge difference and that's why I remember this hotel. Matress was also great. Medium firm just as I like it. I had non-smoking room with king bed. Hotel was quite busy considering that it was Sunday night. When I checked in, clerk said that they were sold out. I guess this is really a popular place. I would definitely recommend staying. It is only about 20 min ride to downtown Toronto. If your flight is early in the morning, you are better off staying at this airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: fankindagirl
Reviews.Content: Great Holiday inn! For what I paid for it on Hotwire, it was wonderful! The rooms were clean, the bed comfortable, and the bar tender made me a cosmo that I will never forget! The food was quite good. The only exception was breakfast when we had some roast beef that looked and tasted rotten. But everyone makes mistakes, and everything at the breakfast buffet was delicious! I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times (Nov 07, Dec 07, and Jan 08) and have enjoyed my experience each time. I tip I would suggest is that I would join the Holiday Inn Rewards Program (Priority Club). Each time i have stayed, I have been upgraded to the Priority Executive Club Floor and have had a great view of the Toronto Airport across the street. Yes, this is a hotel airport, but you can not hear a single plane land or take off. Another great feature of this hotel, is the food. They have a Sushi chef in the bar (not your normal hotel bar, much better) and the sushi is some of the best of I have ever had! The only bad thing is the parking is $12 and if you get there after 5PM, it is hard to find a parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fullermel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and the front desk staff very friendly and accomodating. We had a mixup because of our travel agent, and they fixed us up in a jiffy with a smile. Restaurant was a little dark and the service wasn't fantastic. There was a party going on in the room next to ours so I couldn't sleep until after 1:00 am, when we had to get up at 2:30 am for a red-eye flight out of the country. The shuttle service to the airport was a little slow, but you can rely on it. There was a loud-mouthed intoxicated blond real-estate agent in the lobby waiting for a pizza delivery at 3:00 am. It would have been nice if the staff could have ushered her up to her room, as she was harassing people leaving on their vacations. Also teenagers walking around with beer bottles going for cigarettes out front, which I found odd at that time. Not really a "family" place to stay, especially if you are embarking on a family vacation away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NewBrunswickTravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Select Toronto Intl. during an overnight layover at Pearson Intl. on Feb 29/08. Shuttle: The shuttle goes by T1 every 20 min or so at stand S5. Large bus, not a dinky van. Friendly drivers. Check-in: Checking in was very fast and efficient. I was expecting problems since the reservation was in my girlfriend's name and with her credit card and her flight was cancelled and she was only rebooked for the morning, however there were no problems at all. The room was already paid for so they just took my signature for it. Room: I was on the 8th floor, right by the elevator. The room was very clean, very nice and well furnished. I was only there for a quick sleep so I didn't visit the pool or even turned on the TV. Bathroom: Again, very clean and well stocked, the shower had plenty of hot water and temperature was steady. Food: Had the buffet downstairs for breakfast. Great service from the wait staff. Food was alright, it was buffet so it's not expected to be fantastic. Very expensive, $23 for breakfast buffet, which they bill to your room. Check-out: Very quick, friendly and efficient. Paid for incidentals, got a receipt and was done. Shuttle: Quick shuttle, was at the hotel and got on right away. Dropped me off on the Departures Level right by my check-in aisle. Overall: Highly recommended. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: hinmi
Reviews.Content: I needed to stop over in Toronto twice for one night and chose the Holiday Inn for that. The hotel itself is standard business with spacious rooms and free wireless internet and an adapter for people that needs a wired connection). The facilities are well taken care off and everything just works. However, my excellent rating stems from the staff at the front desk. They are really friendly and try everything to make it right. Also the free coffee and the airport shuttle bus were nice touches. All in all, even though this hotel is a business hotel, for this purpose they do everything right. Another small tip ... if you are there in the evening, try the steakhouse opposite (sorry forgot the name), it's great. All in all, excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front desk and Restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: poohrose
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are wonderful, with one exception, the people that clean the rooms. The front desk staff and the restaurant staff were better than I have seen in most hotels. the food was also very good. The maid service was not good, there was dust every where and even after they sortof cleaned the dust stayed. they would leave dirty dishes in the hall for 3 days.In a hotel of this price I would expect better. Also bring your own pillows. Other than that I would recommend this hotel for its mostly wonderful staff. Location is perfect. 5 min from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Loyal Guest.”
Reviews.Author: JD17
Reviews.Content: This is a great over-all value hotel. Like many of the Holiday Inn hotels, it provides above average accomodations, dining, and ammenities. The restaurant/bar area is very nice, and the pool is very large. I don't expect much at from a Holiday Inn, except for clean accomodations and useful extras (i.e. pool, fitness, internet), and this hotel delivers. What is so great is that it is situated within a minutes drive to the airport and provides a complimentary shuttle service. Everytime I go on vacation, I ALWAYS take advantage of the stop-over rate of the Holiday Inn Select for the night before a trip. It has become custom. This is a solid 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again unless it was free!”
Reviews.Author: HeatSeeker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to a flight the next morning. Our room was about the size of a closet and was old, dingy and outdated. We literally had to move a chair to get around the bed. Our room faced directly onto an overpass and the noise was almost unbearable - we actually never heard any of the planes in the area because the very loud traffic noise drowned out the noise from the jet engines. We have stayed at the Double Tree and the other Holiday Inn (also on Dixon) in previous years prior to flying out of the Toronto airport and they were far superior (cleaner, more current and offering more amenities) and were cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special- Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before an early flight out of Pearson. Nice room, very quiet. The radio was on a classical station when I entered the room. New shower head, good water pressure, although very small bathroom. The rest of the room though was a fairly good size. The express check out invoice wasnâ€™t at my door in the morning at 6:00 am. I called the operator and they had it there five minutes later with a copy of the USA Today. Drive time to Terminal 2 to return my rental car- six minutes including one long stop light on a left hand turn. No complaints. No surprises. A typical Holiday Inn experience. C$154 with all taxes included.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: trvlone
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here two years in a row the night before an early flight. For one reasonable rate you can stay the night before your flight, and leave your car there for 2 weeks, then they will shuttle you back and forth to the airport. The parking for the car was included in the cost of the room. The hotel is well appointed, and comfortable. I found the rooms to be well laid out and nicely decorated. The pool area is nice and clean and enjoyable to use. I enjoy the whirlpool but one year I found it warm only, not hot like a whirlpool should be. The staff was welcoming and helpful, and the food in the restaurant was good, however both years we arrived later (around 7:00 pm) and the restaurant does not seem to be open. The sports bar does serve food but on a more limited menu. The breakfast at the restaurant is quite good. I have had no problems with this hotel and will probably stay there again for this years trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Toronto International Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 970 Dixon Rd., Toronto, Ontario M9W 1J9, Canada
